Curtesy.origin: [Anglo-French curteisie , literally, favor, courtesy, originally in the phrase par la corteysie de Engleterre (tenancy) by courtesy of (the law of) England (as opposed to natural right)]

-sies.definition: [Anglo-French, literally, favor, courtesy, originally in the phrase(tenancy) by courtesy of (the law of) England (as opposed to natural right)]a husband's interest at common law in a life estate upon the death of his wife in the real property that she either solely owned or inherited provided that they bore a child capable of inheriting the property compare,
